headline.main: 2 Ex-Guantanamo Detainees to Tie Knot With Uruguayan Women
headline.print_headline: 2 Ex-Guantanamo Detainees to Tie Knot With Uruguayan Women

docs.snippet: Two former Guantanamo Bay detainees are planning to tie the knot with women from their adopted home of Uruguay....
docs.lead_paragraph: Two former Guantanamo Bay detainees are planning to tie the knot with women from their adopted home of Uruguay.

headline.main: George Pataki Flubs New Hampshire Locale in Kickoff Speech

docs.snippet: Oops. Mr. Pataki, like so many candidates before him and many more to come, misstated exactly where he was....

headline.main: Man Kills Self After California Police Standoff; Family Safe
headline.print_headline: Man Kills Self After California Police Standoff; Family Safe

docs.snippet: An all-day standoff in a San Diego-area apartment complex that began with a gunman killing his neighbor Thursday ended with the man killing himself after two children and his wife emerged unharmed, police said....
docs.lead_paragraph: An all-day standoff in a San Diego-area apartment complex that began with a gunman killing his neighbor Thursday ended with the man killing himself after two children and his wife emerged unharmed, police said.

headline.main: Ukraine President Signs Law Allowing Suspension of Debt Repayments: Press Service
headline.print_headline: Ukraine President Signs Law Allowing Suspension of Debt Repayments: Press Service

docs.snippet: Ukrainian President Petro Poroshenko on Thursday signed a law that gives the government the right to halt scheduled repayments on foreign debts if necessary, his press service said....
docs.lead_paragraph: Ukrainian President Petro Poroshenko on Thursday signed a law that gives the government the right to halt scheduled repayments on foreign debts if necessary, his press service said.

headline.main: George Pataki Takes Aim at Hillary Clinton

docs.snippet: George E. Pataki may be the most centrist candidate running for the Republican presidential nomination, but there was nothing moderate about his criticism of Hillary Rodham Clinton during his announcement speech Thursday....
docs.abstract: George E. Pataki may be the most centrist candidate running for the Republican presidential nomination, but there was nothing moderate about his criticism of Hillary Rodham Clinton during his announcement speech Thursday.

headline.main: Madoff Accountant Sentenced to Home Detention
headline.print_headline: Madoff Accountant Sentenced to Home Detention

docs.snippet: A former accountant who certified fake financial records hiding Bernard Madoff's epic Ponzi scheme was sentenced on Thursday to one year of home confinement, becoming the latest defendant to avoid prison by cooperating in the case....
docs.lead_paragraph: A former accountant who certified fake financial records hiding Bernard Madoff's epic Ponzi scheme was sentenced on Thursday to one year of home confinement, becoming the latest defendant to avoid prison by cooperating in the case.

headline.main: Trial Date Set for Black Virginia Student Bloodied During Arrest
headline.print_headline: Trial Date Set for Black Virginia Student Bloodied During Arrest

docs.snippet: A Virginia judge on Thursday set Sept. 30 as the tentative trial date for a black University of Virginia student who was bloodied while being arrested by white police officers....
docs.lead_paragraph: A Virginia judge on Thursday set Sept. 30 as the tentative trial date for a black University of Virginia student who was bloodied while being arrested by white police officers.

headline.main: Maine Governor Calls for Public Defenders on State Payroll
headline.print_headline: Maine Governor Calls for Public Defenders on State Payroll

docs.snippet: Governor Paul LePage this week proposed overhauling Maine's system for providing the poor with legal representation, a move that would bring the only U.S. state without government-employed public defenders in line with the rest of the country....
docs.lead_paragraph: Governor Paul LePage this week proposed overhauling Maine's system for providing the poor with legal representation, a move that would bring the only U.S. state without government-employed public defenders in line with the rest of the country.
